lines.text: Time does us all in, Mamo! That's the way it's supposed to be.
You can die a hundred more times, it doesn't change a thing. As long as there are either one of you left, I'll keep following you throught the gates of hell!

[gasps]
Lupin?
Alas... only what's left of him.
Hm. What exactly is that supposed to mean?

[walks to her with a rose]
It means, my dear Fujiko, that you are a rose, and I have been pricked by the thorn of your indifference...
"The thorn of my indifference?" Oh, brother...

[smells the rose]
Fatally pricked, and now, almost completely wasted away, my darling.

[chuckles]
Fatally pricked, huh? You gotta love karma!
Yet, there is still one thing that could save me.
What might that be?
If your petal-like lips would but caress my own unworthy sad ones, I might yet survive, my love.
I would, but you know you'd just prick yourself all over again.

[throws the rose away]
Boy, you're all thorns. And after all I went through to get you that damn Stone!

That bum! That rat! He's the real one, all right! So he's still alive, really and truly alive! HAHAHAHAHAHAHA! I won't die until I get him! I'll never give up! I'll follow you down to Hell, and I'll engrave my name on all your stupid bones!
[Zenigata discovers Lupin's body in a crypt]
Who do you think you are, Count Dracula? Well, I read the book, and Dracula gets his in the end, just like you're gonna get yours. Here! Let me treat you a nice "stake" dinner!
[stakes the corpse, which promptly explodes]
Why, Detective Zenigata! Long time no see, Old Man.
Lupin! You're dead! Wait a second, that stiff in the coffin, that was you, right?
So they say. I'm a little confused myself.
They guaranteed that you were deader than a doornail! There wasn't a shadow of a doubt!
It's news to me. Frankly, I've never felt better in my life.
Well, just hold still a second and we can fix that!
[swings a piece of wood at Lupin, who dodges, commencing a chase. By the time Zenigata catches up, Lupin has already reached his escape vehicle]
Hate to cut this short, but dead or alive, I think it's time I got out of here. Now don't forget to write!
[takes off]

Ya little...! I'll be writing "REST IN PEACE" on your tombstone when I'm done with you! That lousy little thief, I knew he was still alive! HAHAHAHAHAHA! You had everyone else falling for it! Not Zenigata! This is one detective you can't shake that easily! This is one guy who will dog your every step to the very gates of Hell!
All this just to bag the two of us. Boy, with the Cold War over, things must be pretty slow.
We can thank Lupin for getting us into this.
Life'd sure be dull without him, wouldn't it?

[shows off the people he's cloned]
This is the work of 10,000 years. A masterwork, if I say so myself. The leading lights of science, philosophy, art. All under one roof, and all are perfectly real!
Hm! So, sort of a Noah's Ark?
Let's just say that if you've never given any thought about the world, starting now would either be a particularly good idea, or a pathetically pointless one, if you catch my drift, Mr. Lupin.
Uh?
Because the time is nigh, Mr. Lupin, but sadly the guest list is... quite short. Only the elite of history's most brilliant and beautiful people!
Oh, uh... I'm sorry to hear that.
[laughs hysterically]
I imagine you are.
No, I mean, it's just after all that work... an ugly, demented gnome like you isn't even eligible!
Once again I have cut a worthless object.
I see you personify the type of genius that's incapable of rational thought.
You know, you're a very rational fellow, Lupin... which of course makes you absurd.
I don't believe it!

[laughing]
Serves you right, lover boy!
Shall we?
Let's go, buddy!
Hey look who's got his game face on!
An unworthy target defiles the weapon.
I have a sinking feeling about this.
You just gave me a great idea, buddy.
Hey, the road's over there!
Shut up!
You want a pillow back there...?
Just drive the damn car.
Goemon!
Hey! You two keep your immorality away from me! Hey! Absolutely no way! Aye yi yi no, don't what the...
It doesn't matter if you die a hundred times, that's not the point! As long as Lupin exists, I'm obliged to pursue him.
Kill, kill, kill let's see kick-ass collateral damage, now you die, ha ha ha ha!
Lupin you should get arrested in the country Arsene Lupin it would promote friendly relations between France and Japan!
Aye yi yi she's awful.
That's how women are!
Pops!
So, let's get away for now!
Ah son of a bitch!
Hey Pops, take it easy, exercise can be awfully dangerous at your age ya know!
Shut up you!
Lupin! Lupin! Don't you know you're supposed to be dead?
So it seems, and that's what's been troubling me.
The thing I can't stand is that secret indecent intention of yours!
Forget it. That's one thing you can never cure.
And just what are you to Lupin? If you were a true friend, you should have cured his immoral habit years ago!
Don't get hysterical, you crazy man!
[a standoff between Goemon and Jigen ensues]
I've been wanting to cut that hat of yours.
Hmm? What's that mean?
I want to see if you're hiding a bald head!
Well, now! Wanna fight?
So, this is the genuine American navy?
It's stupid. This is too unrealistic.
You and me are the things that are unrealistic.
This infantile need to prove your virility is humiliating to behold... and dangerous. Your lust for this creature has blinded you to her true nature.

[sighs]
You're jealous. Both of you.
I warn you - abandon these indecent cravings for the sake of your soul.
Save it. You'll never change him by preaching at him, Goemon.
And you. What kind of friend are you, Jigen? You just encourage him. You treat it as some kind of joke. You're worse than he is.
Hey, I don't have to listen to this!
[a standoff between Goemon and Jigen ensues]
Be careful I don't sink my blade into that hat of yours.
Yeah? You just try it.
On second thought, I'd probably hit solid rock.

Look at this man, Fujiko! This is the man you want to spend the rest of eternity with? This ignorant fool who laughs like a hyena at his own impending doom? I refuse to grant the gift of immortality to one so unworthy!
Well, if that's the way you want to be, you can just count me out, too!
Fujiko!
What's the point of being forever young and lovely? It's no fun if I have to sit by and watch him getting old and shriveled up!

Bad enough that your infantile addiction to this woman has consistently rendered you an unreliable business partner. But even now, as she conspires with others to have us killed, you continue to defend her! It shows that...
Please. Go on. Shows what?
...that you are a weak man of no conviction and no honour.
Come on. You're being a little too harsh, aren't you, Goemon?
It is only natural for you to defend the actions of Lupin, especially since you are responsible for some of his sins as well.
What? Why, you pious jerk!
What?
[a standoff between Goemon and Jigen ensues]
I've always wanted to slash that ridiculous hat of yours!
Huh? What was that?
Guys, come on!
It's probably hiding a bald spot as big as your ass!
Now that's it!
Hey, wait! Come on! Look! You're right, OK? I'll turn over a brand new leaf! The woman is history! Word of honor! Now shake hands, and let's move on, OK?... I said let's go, alright, guys?
Get back here! LUPIN! What the hell are you up to?
Oh, I'd say... at least several hundred feet, with any luck. See ya!
[takes off]
What the hell? Hey! HEY!

[chuckles]
Bye! Catch you later!
A samurai warrior cannot work for a female. You accepted the commission to steal the stone for her only because you like the look of her ass. The wise man has said, "nice asses turn men into asses."
True... that sure was a wise guy.
Your degenerate mockery is getting dangerously irritating!
Goemon, you ain't gonna get anywhere, so give up like I have.
And do you dare to represent yourself as his friend? Willingness to amputate without ether is the test of friendship, and you have failed it!
God, you're such a boring schmuck!
[a standoff between Goemon and Jigen ensues]
The time has come for me to slice off your hat!
Mm? Just try!
We shall see how little brain you have underneath it!
Okay! Try your luck!

[referring to Mamo's promise of eternal life]
I can't believe it. It was all a lie!
Maybe it wasn't. I think he was researching immortality...
He's just another wacky old rich guy.
Or a clone.
Say what?

You said it yourself. The guy had the bucks to pull anything off! Technologically, it's not a big deal anymore. Just a little dab of DNA'll do ya, and theoretically, if you repeat the process over and over again, you - or, successive copies of you - could live forever.
Well, it certainly would explain the mystery of your dear departed doppelganger...
And a single strand of my hair is really all anybody would have needed to do it.
Anybody with a few billion dollars to play with...
Don't be a friggin' idiot!
That's just it... I'd be an idiot if I didn't go!
The world is full of women, Lupin!
It's lousy with women. But not with love.
The process has its limitations.
Limits?

The transfer of the chromosomal data is never accomplished with complete fidelity. There are... anomalies, infinitesimally small in each case, but the cumulative effect of such - chaotic - pollution... can be observed after only a dozen or so generations, and what you see before you is a 130th generation facsimile. I am but a faint, distorted echo of myself.
But you were always distorted by your obsession.
But is it not... everyone's obsession?
Obviously, eternal life would be wasted on a vulgarian like that man there.

[mishears]
That's not true... I eat meat!
